DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Clinical Target Volume Two Fractionation Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number that represents the radiation dose fractions for clinical target volume 2 (CTV2).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Clinical Target Volume Two Fractionation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The tissue volume that contains a demonstrable gross target volume and/or sub-clinical microscopic malignant disease, which has to be eliminated. This volume must be treated adequately in order to achieve the aim of therapy, cure or palliation._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The tissue volume that contains a demonstrable gross target volume and/or sub-clinical microscopic malignant disease, which has to be eliminated. This volume must be treated adequately in order to achieve the aim of therapy, cure or palliation.:A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.:Dividing the total dose of radiation therapy into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

Concepts.definition: The tissue volume that contains a demonstrable gross target volume and/or sub-clinical microscopic malignant disease, which has to be eliminated. This volume must be treated adequately in order to achieve the aim of therapy, cure or palliation.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
Radiation therapy in which the total dose delivered is divided into several smaller, equal doses delivered over a period of several days.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 11/19/18 jk upd reg status from Application to Qualified; added MCL CSI reference.  10/30/2017 wz created for DCP NWU datatype and size constraint. 09/15/2021 it added the number of decimal places (4)

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
